body:
The current MLlfow backends supported are compatible with SQLAlchemy. If there's a SQL compatible connector to Snowflake, then it might be possible to extend the SQLAlchemy backend. 

While this is a good idea to extend the ecosystem, however,  it would be a big project for someone from the MLflow community to contribute. As such, we would appreciate starting with a short design that spells out different scenarios and expected behavior.

Hi @dmatrix ,

Snowflake has their own native python connector as well as and sql alchemy backend: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/sqlalchemy.html

I would try to provide more information for the scenarios and the expected behaviour. But basically as I pointed the idea would be to re run the same features that are available for the backend store with MySQL or SQLlite in snowflake. Probably the functions affected would be:

```python
mlflow.set_tracking_uri() 
mlflow.tracking.get_tracking_uri() 
mlflow.create_experiment() 
mlflow.set_experiment() 
mlflow.start_run()
mlflow.end_run() 
mlflow.active_run() 
mlflow.log_param() 
mlflow.log_metric()
mlflow.set_tag() 
mlflow.log_artifact()  #maybe?
mlflow.log_artifacts() #maybe? 
mlflow.get_artifact_uri()  #maybe?
```

Snowflake is ANSI SQL compliant so I believe that this will simplify some of the modifications.

BR
/Edgar
Thanks for responding. The next step is to design and follow some of the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst).

Hi @dmatrix 

We tried to add snowflake to the SQL alchemy backends but we got the following error:
```

(python3) [ec2-user@xxx-xxx-xxx i snowflake-test]$ mlflow server --backend-store-uri "snowflake://<user>:<password>@doman.aws-region/MCOG/my_user?role=my_role&warehouse=my_warehouse" --default-artifact-root file:/./mlruns -h 0.0.0.0 -p 5000 >> mlflow-error-log.txt
/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/cloudpickle/cloudpickle.py:47: DeprecationWarning: the imp module is deprecated in favour of importlib; see the module's documentation for alternative uses

2020/06/01 16:19:09 ERROR mlflow.cli: Error initializing backend store

Traceback (most recent call last):

    context)
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/default.py", line 509, in do_execute
    cursor.execute(statement, parameters)
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/snowflake/connector/cursor.py", line 603, in execute

snowflake.connector.errors.ProgrammingError: 001003 (42000): SQL compilation error:

syntax error line 7 at position 77 unexpected ''deleted''.
syntax error line 7 at position 87 unexpected ')'.

The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:

  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 101, in initialize_backend_stores

  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/store/tracking/sqlalchemy_store.py", line 99, in __init__

  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/sqlalchemy/sql/visitors.py", line 121, in traverse_single

  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 948, in execute

  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1009, in _execute_ddl
    compiled
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1200, in _execute_context
    context)

    exc_info
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/sqlalchemy/util/compat.py", line 265, in raise_from_cause
    reraise(type(exception), exception, tb=exc_tb, cause=cause)
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/sqlalchemy/util/compat.py", line 248, in reraise
    raise value.with_traceback(tb)
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1193, in _execute_context
    context)
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/default.py", line 509, in do_execute
    cursor.execute(statement, parameters)
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/snowflake/connector/cursor.py", line 603, in execute
    errvalue)
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/snowflake/connector/errors.py", line 97, in errorhandler_wrapper
    cursor.errorhandler(connection, cursor, errorclass, errorvalue)
  File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/envs/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/snowflake/connector/errors.py", line 73, in default_errorhandler
    done_format_msg=errorvalue.get(u'done_format_msg'))
sqlalchemy.exc.ProgrammingError: (snowflake.connector.errors.ProgrammingError) 001003 (42000): SQL compilation error:
syntax error line 7 at position 40 unexpected 'CHECK'.
syntax error line 7 at position 77 unexpected ''deleted''.
syntax error line 7 at position 87 unexpected ')'. [SQL: "\nCREATE TABLE experiments (\n\texperiment_id INTEGER NOT NULL AUTOINCREMENT, \n\tname VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL, \n\tartifact_location VARCHAR(256), \n\tlifecycle_stage VARCHAR(32), \n\tCONSTRAINT experiment_pk PRIMARY KEY (experiment_id), \n\tCONSTRAINT experiments_lifecycle_stage CHECK (lifecycle_stage IN ('active', 'deleted')), \n\tUNIQUE (name)\n)\n\n"] (Background on this error at: http://sqlalche.me/e/f405)
```

Any hints?

@edgBR 

This seems be an error from the connector code trying to create experiment table. I would debug this by trying to create the table using `sqlalchemy` library (which MLflow uses for `SqlAlchemyStore` backend) and try and create the experiment table as defined with the DML printed above. The `CHECK` keyword seems to be an issue which is required to ensure that value for  `lifecycle_stage ` field is a valid one. This is enforced by SQL Alchemy `CheckConstraint`.

Possible solutions:
1. You may need to reach out to the creator of the library for advice on how to address this.
2. Use the [plugin](https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/plugins.html) mechanism to support this backend for your use case. You may be able to reuse the code from `SqlAlchemyStore` implementations.

To answer your other question, I would recommend using one of the existing [Artifact Store implementations](https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/tracking.html#artifact-stores) to store experiment run and model artifacts.
